items.title: Why Australia Day is really held on 26 January
items.summary: Australia's national day hasn't always been held on 26 January. Here's a brief history as the campaign to change the date continues.

items.title: 'I have two homes': Five migrants share what being Australian means to them
items.summary: Hailing from all around the world, these five migrants share why they're grateful to be Australian, despite social cohesion challenges.

items.title: Too young to be a widow, my First Nations community saved me
items.summary: Sarah Malone was 49 years old when she was widowed. She says the experience has highlighted the value of Indigenous cultural systems.

items.title: Whadjuk-Yued Noongar electrician named Australia's Local Hero
items.summary: Over the past decade, Frank has overseen the investment of $11billion awarded to Aboriginal subcontractors and more than 70 Aboriginal people employed.

items.title: Alex Pretti's parents say 'lies' being told about their son as Trump officials defend shooting
items.summary: Footage appears to contradict Trump officials' claim that Alex Pretti was brandishing a gun and resisting officers when he was shot.

items.title: Voice architect says Jan 26 debate is 'low hanging fruit'; protesters maintain calls to abolish day
items.summary: Protest rallies in cities across the country have called for January 26 to be reframed, while Professor Megan Davis says structural conditions must change.

items.title: See the full list: Here's who's been awarded Australia Day honours in 2026
items.summary: Nearly 950 Australians have been recognised this year.

items.title: A century ago, the average Australian was a 24-year-old man. Who is it now?
items.summary: Australia celebrates its national day on Monday, but do we really know who we are?

items.title: The Aussie dollar has reached a 15-month high. What does this mean for us?
items.summary: A strong Australian dollar could be welcome news for overseas travellers and household budgets.

items.title: Astronaut and three other 'visionaries' receive Australian of the Year awards
items.summary: An astronaut, an ultramarathon runner, a dementia researcher, and an Indigenous construction leader have been recognised for their achievements.

items.title: 'They think we're billionaires': This couple inherited a manor. It's been anything but idyllic
items.summary: Inheriting property is often complex. When Anne-Sophie and Olivier inherited a 500-year-old château, it presented some unique challenges.

items.title: Tension mounts in Minneapolis after fatal shooting of man who 'cared about people deeply'
items.summary: The 37-year-old man is the second civilian to have been fatally shot in Minneapolis since Trump sent immigration enforcement officials to the city.

items.title: Fires continue to burn as huge swathes of south-east face severe heatwave warnings
items.summary: Parts of Australia are bracing for the effects of fire and extreme heat, while others are at risk of flash flooding.

items.title: Police descend on remote town after possible sighting of alleged triple murderer
items.summary: A small former mining town in central NSW has become the focus of a police search after a potential sighting of Julian Ingram.

items.title: Albanese names 'outstanding' replacement for Rudd as US ambassador
items.summary: Anthony Albanese has tapped a defence boss and experienced diplomat for the coveted role in Washington DC.

items.title: Man charged over 'abhorrent' threat to Sydney mosque
items.summary: The material posted to Sydney's Lakemba Mosque singled out Muslims, Middle Eastern communities, Indigenous people and left-wing politicians.

items.title: Australian veterans, RSL respond to Trump's 'profound insult' of US allies' soldiers
items.summary: Australians have joined a chorus of disgust across Europe after Trump said allies' troops had stayed "a little off the front lines" in Afghanistan.

items.title: Aussie survivor through to next round after Naomi Osaka pulls out of Australian Open
items.summary: Maddison Inglis, the last remaining home hope in the Australian Open women's draw, will progress to round four after Naomi Osaka pulled out of the tournament.

items.title: Australia Day 2026: Here’s what's open over the long weekend
items.summary: Most shops will be open but in some states they are subject to restricted hours. In one state car and boat dealerships will close.

items.title: Allowed to beg, forbidden to study: Why conditions for Afghan women are worsening
items.summary: Despite an injection of more than $260 million in Australian aid, the situation for women in Afghanistan remains 'bleak'.

items.title: After a night out, men and women face very different heart health risks
items.summary: Alcohol consumption can lead to a range of health issues, and your risk level can change based on a range of factors.

items.title: Fighting fakes and food fraud, this team knows where your festive dish really comes from
items.summary: Almost five million people in Australia fall ill each year from unsafe or contaminated food. Australian technology is helping combat this growing global problem.

items.title: Twelve-year-old boy dies from injuries after Sydney shark attack
items.summary: A 12-year-old boy who was bitten by a shark in Sydney's east last week has succumbed to his critical leg injuries.

items.title: Zelenskyy suggested European leaders are weak. Can they stand up to Trump?
items.summary: Trump has supposedly secured a decision on Greenland. Experts say specifics are still unclear — though the threats will be remembered.
